column4: I'm setting up a box vista box as a security camera server... how can I access that via ubuntu? anyone know any good solutions to this?
rdesktop?
looking into it
your other option would be VNC, but I'd recommend rdesktop over that if it's windows XP or vista.
yea i tried VNC and it's not what I was looking for
rdesktop either spawns a virtual session or connects to the desktop (Depending on how windows is set up).  It can do whatever resolution you want.
basically someone else may be using the vista computer... I want to connect in the background
rdesktop woudl do that?
hmm... I don't think so.  See, in XP, it locks the machine and kicks the current user out.
you're connecting to the same session though.
basically microsoft wants you to use the server versions if you are having multiple people connected at a time.
hrm... you know what I mean tho right?
well then what about connecting to the same session w/ vnc but not disturbing the user on the computer?
yeah, totally.  I'd imagine there's a registry hack out there for XP / Vista home to let you do that.  Although you might check to see if vista premium lets you do that.
you can do view-only vnc connections, but...
basically the computer is doing double doubty. First it's the wifes work computer and second it's the baby monitor
do you know of anything that could do that.?
well vista CAN do that.  It's just a matter of convincing it that multiple sessions are allow.  I've never tried that since I haven't touched vista much. :)
since i really only use linux... i need someone to hand-hold me through the process =/
